TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 591
TEI.2.document_title: J F Madero to John Davis Bradburn, 01-28-1831

barker_notes.barker_summary: José Francisco Madero to Juan Davis Bradburn, January 28, 1831. Explains that his commission, does not apply to immigrants who arrived after passage of the law of April 6, 1830, and that the Federal authorities had approved the settlements within the coast and border reserves. (Omitted.)1126
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 591

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*José Francisco Madero to Juan Davis Bradburn, January 28, 1831. Explains that his commission, does not apply to immigrants who arrived after passage of the law of April 6, 1830, and that the Federal authorities had approved the settlements within the coast and border reserves. (Omitted.) */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Atascosito*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="01-28-1831">January 28, 1831.*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*See Calendar.*/p*
*/div1*
